statement_context: an event in Port Washington, N.Y.
ruling_headline: A look at Hillary Clinton's claim about Vermont's gun pipeline to New York
statement: "The state that has the highest per capita number of … guns that end up committing crimes in New York come from Vermont."

statement_context: an interview on NBC's "Meet the Press"
ruling_headline: Clinton voted for 'virtually every' trade agreement, killing millions of jobs, Sanders says
statement: Says Hillary Clinton voted "for virtually every trade agreement that has cost the workers of this country millions of jobs."

ruling_headline: Hillary Clinton says Bernie Sanders wants higher standards for toy guns than real guns
statement: Says Bernie Sanders "wants higher standards for toy guns than real guns."

ruling_headline: Does Clinton really have 2.5 million more votes than Sanders?
statement: "I have 2 and a half million more votes than he (Sanders) does."

ruling_headline: Hillary Clinton spins on ‘Meet the Press,’ says she put out all her emails
statement: "I have now put out all of my emails."

ruling_headline: Hillary Clinton's absurd claim that she's the only candidate being attacked by Wall Street
statement: "I'm the only candidate in the Democratic primary, or actually on either side, who Wall Street financiers and hedge fund managers are actually running ads against."

ruling_headline: Evidence backs Hillary Clinton claim that torture is counterproductive for counterterrorism
statement: When it comes to fighting terrorism, "Another thing we know that does not work, based on lots of empirical evidence, is torture."

ruling_headline: Hillary Clinton: US negotiated agreement that made it easier to get EU flight data
statement: "It’s actually easier for the United States to get flight manifests from E.U. nations than it is for E.U. nations to get them from their own neighbors, thanks to an agreement the U.S. negotiated when I was secretary of state."

ruling_headline: Hillary Clinton says guns exceed next nine categories as leading cause of death for young black men
statement: "Gun violence is by far the leading cause of death for young African American men, outstripping the next nine causes of death combined."

statement_context: a Democratic presidential debate in Miami
ruling_headline: Hillary Clinton says Bernie Sanders supported Minutemen, indefinite detention for the undocumented
statement: In 2006, Bernie Sanders "voted in the House with hard-line Republicans for indefinite detention for undocumented immigrants, and then he sided with those Republicans to stand with vigilantes known as Minutemen who were taking up outposts along the border to hunt down immigrants."

statement_context: in the Democratic debate in Florida
ruling_headline: Hillary Clinton wrongly says Bernie Sanders wants to delay the Clean Power Plan
statement: "The Clean Power Plan is something that Sen. Sanders has said he would delay implementing."

statement_context: the Democratic debate at Miami Dade College
ruling_headline: Sanders said Clinton backed return for undocumented kids
statement: When Honduran children came into this country, "Secretary Clinton said send them back."

ruling_headline: Hillary Clinton said 'my predecessors did the same thing' with email
statement: Regarding her State Department email practices, "my predecessors did the same thing."

ruling_headline: Hedge fund-backed PAC attacks Clinton's Wall Street ties
statement: Banks paid Hillary Clinton "over $1 million and are contributing millions more to elect her."

statement_context: a Democratic presidential debate in Flint, Mich.
ruling_headline: Bernie Sanders says he consistently beats Donald Trump by bigger margins than Hillary Clinton does
statement: "Almost every poll has shown that Sanders vs. Trump does a lot better than Clinton vs. Trump … and, that’s true nationally."

ruling_headline: In Michigan, Hillary Clinton says Bernie Sanders 'was against the auto bailout'
statement: Says Bernie Sanders "was against the auto bailout" and "voted against the money that ended up saving the auto industry."

ruling_headline: Hillary Clinton: Cleveland has higher rates of lead poisoning than Flint
statement: "We have a higher rate of tested lead in people in Cleveland than in Flint."

statement_context: a Democratic debate in Flint, Mich.
ruling_headline: Hillary Clinton: Barack Obama set new Wall Street fundraising record when he first ran for president
statement: "President Obama took more money from Wall Street in the 2008 campaign than anybody ever had."

statement_context: a Republican presidential debate in Detroit
ruling_headline: Ted Cruz says Donald Trump wrote 10 checks to Hillary Clinton campaigns
statement: Says Donald Trump has written 10 checks to Hillary Clinton "and four of those checks were not to her Senate campaign. … It was to her presidential campaign."

statement_context: a Republican presidential debate in Detroit
ruling_headline: John Kasich correct that he polls best among GOP hopefuls against Hillary Clinton
statement: In head-to-head polls for the general election, "I beat Hillary Clinton by more than anybody, by 11 points."

ruling_headline: Hillary Clinton is off-base on comparison of mortgage rejections by race
statement: "You are three times more likely to be able to get a mortgage if you're a white applicant than if you're black or Hispanic, even if you have the same credentials."

ruling_headline: Hillary Clinton says blacks more likely to be arrested, get longer sentences
statement: "African-Americans are more likely to be arrested by police and sentenced to longer prison terms for doing the same thing that whites do."

ruling_headline: Hillary Clinton says she wants to return minimum wage to high of '$12 an hour in today's dollars'
statement: Says she will "work to raise the federal minimum wage back to the highest level it’s ever been — $12 an hour in today’s dollars."

statement_context: comments during the PBS Democratic debate
ruling_headline: Did Bernie Sanders call President Barack Obama 'weak' and 'a disappointment'?
statement: Says Sen. Bernie Sanders has called President Barack Obama "weak. He's called him a disappointment."

statement_context: a Democratic presidential debate in Milwaukee
ruling_headline: Americans really haven't had a raise in 15 years, as Hillary Clinton says
statement: "Americans haven’t had a raise in 15 years."

statement_context: the GOP primary debate in New Hampshire
ruling_headline: Marco Rubio says Hillary Clinton supports abortions 'even on the due date'
statement: Says Hillary Clinton "believes that all abortions should be legal, even on the due date of that unborn child."

ruling_headline: Hillary Clinton says Bernie Sanders doesn't have a foreign policy adviser network
statement: "There really isn’t any kind of foreign policy network that is supporting and advising Sen. Sanders."

statement_context: comments during the New Hampshire Democratic debate
ruling_headline: Hillary Clinton says she didn't endorse the TPP trade deal until it was actually negotiated
statement: "I waited until (the Trans-Pacific Partnership trade agreement) had actually been negotiated" before deciding whether to endorse it.

statement_context: the Democratic debate in Durham, N.H.
ruling_headline: Clinton says Sanders proposed Iranian troops in Syria
statement: Says Bernie Sanders advocated putting "Iranian troops into Syria to try and resolve the conflict there. Putting them right on the doorstep of Israel."

ruling_headline: Hillary Clinton compares Benghazi to 1983 attack on Marines in Beirut
statement: When terrorists killed more than 250 Americans in Lebanon under Ronald Reagan, "the Democrats didn’t make that a partisan issue."

ruling_headline: Hillary Clinton wrong to say she's only candidate to lay out a 'specific plan' to fight ISIS
statement: "I am the only candidate on either side who has laid out a specific plan about what I would do to defeat ISIS."

statement_context: comments at a campaign organizing event
ruling_headline: Spot check of Hillary Clinton's Senate record fails to support bipartisanship claim
statement: "Every piece of legislation, just about, that I ever introduced (in the U.S. Senate) had a Republican co-sponsor."

statement_context: comments during the South Carolina Democratic presidential debate
ruling_headline: Hillary Clinton: 'We now have driven costs down to the lowest they've been in 50 years'
statement: "We now have driven (health care) costs down to the lowest they've been in 50 years."

ruling_headline: Fact-checking Hillary Clinton's claim that Bernie Sanders supported 'Charleston Loophole'
statement: Says Bernie Sanders "voted for what we call the 'Charleston Loophole.'"

statement_context: comments during the South Carolina Democratic presidential debate
ruling_headline: Hillary Clinton correct that Bernie Sanders flip-flopped on liability for gun makers, sellers
statement: Says Bernie Sanders "has reversed his position on immunity" for gun manufacturers and sellers.

ruling_headline: Carly Fiorina says U.S. didn't address cybersecurity in economic dialogues with China
statement: "When we held recent economic dialogues with China, we agreed on over 100 different things  —  including wildlife trafficking and volcano research. None of these 100-plus points of agreement addressed cybersecurity."

statement_context: a posting on the Clinton website
ruling_headline: Hillary Clinton's Syrian airstrikes claim against Marco Rubio ignores difference in strategy
statement: "Marco Rubio voted against authorizing President Obama to strike Syria after Assad used chemical weapons on his own people."

statement_context: a Democratic debate in New Hampshire
ruling_headline: Hillary Clinton says Bernie Sanders voted for regime change in Libya
statement: Says Bernie Sanders "voted for regime change with respect to Libya."

ruling_headline: No evidence for Hillary Clinton's claim that ISIS is using videos of Donald Trump as recruiting tool
statement: ISIS is "going to people showing videos of Donald Trump insulting Islam and Muslims in order to recruit more radical jihadists."

ruling_headline: Hillary Clinton says background check of Charleston church shooter wasn't 'fast enough'
statement: The Charleston, S.C., shooter "should have never been given a gun, but the universal background check was not fast enough."

statement_context: a post on her campaign website
ruling_headline: Hillary Clinton's exaggerated claim that Ted Cruz 'tried to ban contraception' five times
statement: "Ted Cruz tried to ban contraception" five times.

statement_context: a speech to the Council on Foreign Relations
ruling_headline: Hillary Clinton says 'the Libyan people have voted twice in free and fair elections'
statement: "The Libyan people have voted twice in free and fair elections for the kind of leadership they want."

ruling_headline: Hillary Clinton says she helped usher Iran to the negotiating table
statement: "I spent 18 months putting together the sanctions against Iran so that we could force them to the negotiating table."

ruling_headline: Hillary Clinton: 3,000 killed by guns between Nevada and Iowa Democratic debates
statement: "Since we last debated in Las Vegas, nearly 3,000 people have been killed by guns."

statement_context: a Democratic presidential debate in Des Moines, Iowa
ruling_headline: Hillary Clinton says wages haven't risen since turn of the century
statement: "Wages adjusted for inflation haven’t risen since the turn of the last century."

ruling_headline: Ben Carson says Hillary Clinton gave conflicting accounts about Benghazi
statement: Says Hillary Clinton told her daughter and a government official that Benghazi "was a terrorist attack, and then tells everybody else that it was a video."

ruling_headline: Clinton says John Kerry was the first secretary of state to rely on a government email account
statement: Says John Kerry "is the first secretary of state to rely primarily on a government account."

ruling_headline: O'Malley: Hillary Clinton doesn't want to reinstate Glass-Steagall
statement: Says Hillary Clinton "couldn't bring herself to say we need to separate commercial banking and speculative banking, namely reinstating Glass-Steagall."

statement_context: a town hall-style campaign event in Iowa
ruling_headline: Clinton: Gun industry is 'wholly protected' from all lawsuits
statement: The gun industry is "the only business in America that is wholly protected from any kind of liability."

ruling_headline: Hillary Clinton claims Edward Snowden had whistleblower protections, didn't use them
statement: Says Edward Snowden "could have gotten all of the protections of being a whistleblower."

ruling_headline: Clinton says her Keystone XL position isn't a flip-flop
statement: On the Keystone XL pipeline

ruling_headline: What Hillary Clinton really said about TPP and the 'gold standard'
statement: Says as secretary of state she was reserving judgment about the Trans-Pacific Partnership and "hoped it would be the gold standard."

ruling_headline: Hillary Clinton: Bernie Sanders voted against Brady bill five times
statement: "Sen. Sanders did vote five times against the Brady bill."

ruling_headline: Clinton: 7 Benghazi probes so far
statement: "There have been seven investigations (of Benghazi) led mostly by Republicans in the Congress" that concluded "nobody did anything wrong, but there were changes we could make."

ruling_headline: Less than 1% of noncompliant gun dealers get their licenses revoked. Here's why
statement: "While 38 percent of (firearms) dealers that were inspected in 2011 were noncompliant with federal law, only 0.05 percent of inspected dealers had their licenses revoked."

ruling_headline: Hillary Clinton flip-flops on Trans-Pacific Partnership
statement: On the Trans-Pacific Partnership.

ruling_headline: Clinton campaign: Benghazi probe is Congress' longest investigation ever
statement: The Benghazi probe is "the longest-running congressional investigation ever."

statement_context: remarks at the 2015 New Hampshire Democratic Party State Convention
ruling_headline: Hillary Clinton: Recessions more frequent under Republicans than Democrats
statement: "Under Republicans, recessions happen four times as frequently as under Democrats."

statement_context: an op-ed in the New Hampshire Union-Leader
ruling_headline: Hillary Clinton says '23 million Americans suffer from addiction, but only 1 in 10 get treatment'
statement: "Twenty-three million Americans suffer from addiction, but only 1 in 10 get treatment."

statement_context: an interview with Iowa Public Radio
ruling_headline: Hillary Clinton: Emails wouldn't be public if I hadn't asked for it
statement: "If I had not asked for my emails all to be made public, none of this would have been in the public arena."

ruling_headline: Hillary Clinton tweets that Florida got an F for college affordability under Jeb Bush
statement: "F: The grade given to Florida for college affordability under Jeb Bush's leadership."

statement_context: a speech to the National Urban League in Fort Lauderdale, Fla.
ruling_headline: Clinton accurately says black children with asthma have 500% higher mortality rate
statement: "African-American children are 500 percent more likely to die from asthma than white kids."

statement_context: a town hall in Nashua, N.H.
ruling_headline: Hillary Clinton says the stock market has done better under Democratic presidents
statement: "The stock market does better when you have a Democratic president in the White House."

ruling_headline: Meme says Hillary Clinton 'refuses' to testify on Benghazi attack
statement: Says Hillary Clinton "refuses to testify before Congress" about the 2012 attack in Benghazi.

ruling_headline: Would Rubio's tax plan mean a big break for millionaires?
statement: "Sen. Rubio’s (tax plan) would cut taxes for households making around $3 million a year by almost $240,000, which is way more than three times the earnings of a typical family."

ruling_headline: Hillary Clinton says she called for Wall Street regulations early in the financial crisis
statement: Says she "called for addressing risks of derivatives, cracking down on subprime mortgages and improving financial oversight" early on in the financial crisis.

ruling_headline: Meme says Hillary Clinton's top donors are banks and corporations, Bernie Sanders' are labor unions
statement: Says Hillary Clinton’s top 10 donors are mainly "banks, corporations and media," while Bernie Sanders’ top 10 donors are labor unions.

ruling_headline: American schools are 'more segregated than they were in the 1960s,' says Hillary Clinton
statement: American schools are "more segregated than they were in the 1960s."

statement_context: comments on CNN's State of the Union
ruling_headline: Bill Clinton says Hillary was 'completely exonerated' in Whitewater
statement: Says Hillary Clinton "was completely exonerated, when I was in the White House" by an official inquiry on Whitewater.

statement_context: comments on CNN's State of the Union
ruling_headline: No media coverage of Hillary Clinton's 'exoneration' in Whitewater, says Bill Clinton
statement: After a federal inquiry corroborated Hillary Clinton on Whitewater, "the next day, there was nothing in the media about it."

statement_context: a video with the Human Rights Campaign.
ruling_headline: Hillary Clinton’s changing position on same-sex marriage
statement: On same-sex marriage.

ruling_headline: Hillary Clinton: Top hedge fund managers make more than all kindergarten teachers combined
statement: "The top 25 hedge fund managers (are) making more than all of America's kindergarten teachers combined."

ruling_headline: A federal court said Rick Perry okayed a law intended to discriminate, says Hillary Clinton
statement: "Former Gov. Rick Perry signed a law that a federal court said was actually written with the purpose of discriminating against minority voters."

ruling_headline: Hillary Clinton says Chris Christie vetoed early voting
statement: "In New Jersey, Gov. Christie vetoed legislation to extend early voting."

ruling_headline: Had the Goldman Sachs CEO said his picks are Hillary Clinton or Jeb Bush?
statement: "The CEO of Goldman Sachs let his employees know that he’d be just fine with either Bush or Clinton."

statement_context: an appearance in Mason City, Iowa
ruling_headline: Hillary Clinton says hedge fund managers 'pay less in taxes than nurses and truck drivers'
statement: Hedge fund managers "pay less in taxes than nurses and truck drivers."

statement_context: an appearance at a high school in Las Vegas, Nev.
ruling_headline: Hillary Clinton says 'not one' GOP presidential contender backs path to citizenship
statement: "Not a single Republican candidate, announced or potential, is clearly and consistently supporting a path to citizenship. Not one."

statement_context: an appearance at a high school in Las Vegas, Nev.
ruling_headline: Hillary Clinton says 'not one' GOP presidential contender backs path to citizenship
statement: "Not a single Republican candidate, announced or potential, is clearly and consistently supporting a path to citizenship. Not one."

statement_context: an appearance at a high school in Las Vegas, Nev.
ruling_headline: Hillary Clinton says 'not one' GOP presidential contender backs path to citizenship
statement: "Not a single Republican candidate, announced or potential, is clearly and consistently supporting a path to citizenship. Not one."

statement_context: a speech at the Women in the World conference
ruling_headline: Hillary Clinton says U.S. ranks only 65th in world for gender pay equity
statement: "The United States is 65th out of 142 nations and other territories on equal pay."

statement_context: a roundtable at a community college
ruling_headline: Hillary Clinton says U.S. was first to create community colleges
statement: "The United States invented the community college. Nobody else had ever done anything like it."

ruling_headline: In Iowa, Hillary Clinton claims 'all my grandparents' came to the U.S. from foreign countries
statement: Says "all my grandparents" immigrated to America.

ruling_headline: Hillary Clinton says women earned twice as many computer science degrees in the 1980s as today
statement: "You had more women getting computer sciences degrees in the '80s by a factor of 2-plus than you do now."

ruling_headline: Conservative group claims Hillary Clinton's foundation took millions from foreign governments
statement: "The Clintons' foundation took millions from foreign governments" including United Arab Emirates and Saudi Arabia.

statement_context: an interview on PBS' "The Charlie Rose Show"
ruling_headline: Hillary Clinton says economic stats were 100 times better under Bill Clinton than Ronald Reagan
statement: The number of jobs created and people lifted out of poverty during Bill Clinton’s presidency was "a hundred times" what it was under President Ronald Reagan.

statement_context: an interview at the Aspen Ideas Festival
ruling_headline: Hillary Clinton says a Hobby Lobby salesclerk 'is not going to get' contraception
statement: "A salesclerk at Hobby Lobby who needs contraception … is not going to get that service through her employer’s health care plan because her employer doesn’t think she should be using contraception."

ruling_headline: Hillary Clinton says by 2006, Americans 'were overwhelmingly against the Iraq War'
statement: "By 2006, the American people were overwhelmingly against the Iraq War."

ruling_headline: Reince Priebus says Hillary Clinton's poll numbers have plummeted
statement: Says Hillary Clinton’s approval rating went from 70 percent to 52 percent in 18 months.

ruling_headline: Hillary Clinton says in memoir that there's very little U.S. military presence in Africa
statement: "The U.S. military footprint in Africa is nearly nonexistent."

ruling_headline: Hillary Clinton says in Iran in 1979, extremists hijacked a broad-based, popular revolution against the Shah
statement: "In Iran in 1979, the extremists hijacked the broad-based popular revolution against the Shah and established a brutal theocracy."

ruling_headline: Hillary Clinton says by 2009, U.S. drones had killed 'dozens' of senior terrorists
statement: By 2009, "dozens of senior terrorists had been taken off the battlefield" by drones.

ruling_headline: Hillary Clinton says she and Bill were 'dead broke'
statement: "We came out of the White House not only dead broke, but in debt."

ruling_headline: In new book, Hillary Clinton touts quality-of-life advances in Afghanistan
statement: "By the time I left" the State Department, "economic growth was up and opium production was down" in Afghanistan, while "infant mortality declined" and school enrollment rose by more than sevenfold.

statement_context: a speech at the New America Foundation
ruling_headline: Hillary Clinton says United States is falling behind Canada on key measurements
statement: "Canadian middle class incomes are now higher than in the United States. They are working fewer hours for more pay, … living longer on average, and facing less income inequality."

ruling_headline: Hillary Clinton says people don't like health care law, but like its individual components
statement: "A small majority of Americans don’t think they like the Affordable Care Act, but a large majority of Americans don’t want to do away with the protections that are in the Affordable Care Act."

statement_context: an appearance on CNN’s ‘State of the Union’
ruling_headline: Rand Paul  says Hillary Clinton was ‘asked repeatedly to provide security in Benghazi … including direct cables’
statement: Says Hillary Clinton "was asked repeatedly to provide security in Benghazi on several occasions, including direct cables."

statement_context: the vice presidential debate in Danville, Ky.
ruling_headline: Paul Ryan says Obama administration called Bashar Assad 'a reformer'
statement: The Obama administration "called Bashar Assad a reformer when he was turning his Russian-provided guns on his own people."

ruling_headline: Hillary Clinton doesn't answer hypothetical questions? Sometimes
statement: "I don't answer hypotheticals."

ruling_headline: Greenspan gave approval to tax cuts only if deficits were tamed
statement: In 2001, former Federal Reserve chairman Alan Greenspan "justified increasing spending and cutting taxes, saying that we didn't really need to pay down the debt."

statement_context: a speech at the Democratic National Convention.
ruling_headline: No, he's just not okay with one bill
statement: McCain "still thinks it's okay when women don't earn equal pay for equal work."

ruling_headline: McCain not committed to 'privatization'
statement: "John McCain wants to privatize Social Security."

ruling_headline: Counting votes is tricky this year
statement: "We are winning the popular vote."

ruling_headline: Campaign in '68 didn't start until March
statement: It doesn't make sense "historically" to drop out because the 1968 race was still competitive when "Bobby Kennedy was assassinated in June in California."

ruling_headline: Numbers don't add up
statement: "The White House is won in the swing states, and I am winning the swing states."

ruling_headline: 2000, yes, but not 2004
statement: "If West Virginia had voted for our Democratic nominee in 2000 and 2004, we wouldn't have had to put up with George Bush for the last 7 years."

ruling_headline: Yes - and we borrow from the Saudis, too
statement: "We borrow money from the Chinese to buy oil from the Saudis."

statement_context: a speech at a Democratic Party dinner
ruling_headline: Supercars unlikely in a couple years
statement: There are prototype cars that get between 100 and 150 miles per gallon and "we could have those cars in your garages in a couple of years."

ruling_headline: Only if "you" are a family of four
statement: "If you are driving on average in America this summer, you'll save — according to Department of Energy figures — about $70."

ruling_headline: A reasonable estimate for uninsured costs
statement: Every family health insurance policy has "a $900 hidden tax" to subsidize health care costs of the uninsured.

ruling_headline: Rates were a lot higher back in the day
statement: Tax rates were significantly higher "in the '40s, the '50s, and the '60s."

ruling_headline: Clinton and Obama differ on freeze
statement: Hillary Clinton advocates "a freeze on foreclosures. Barack Obama said no."

statement_context: a speech at the University of Pennsylvania.
ruling_headline: An early voice on foreclosures
statement: "A year ago, in March 2007, I called for immediate action to address abuses in the subprime market, and I laid out detailed concrete proposals for how to do so."

ruling_headline: Hard numbers are just guess-timates
statement: Barack Obama's health care plan "will cost taxpayers $1,700 more to cover each new person."

ruling_headline: Murder rate is down this year
statement: "More than one person, on average, a day is murdered in Philadelphia."

statement_context: a TV ad airing in Pennsylvania.
ruling_headline: Yes, oil company employees have donated to Obama
statement: "Barack Obama accepted $200,000 from executives and employees of oil companies."

statement_context: a TV ad airing in Pennsylvania.
ruling_headline: Slippery math, loaded words
statement: "Obama voted for the Bush-Cheney energy bill that put $6-billion in the pocket of big oil."

ruling_headline: A 9/11 denier? Yup
statement: "Again today (Ahmadinejad) made light of 9/11, and said that he's not even sure it happened and that people actually died."

statement_context: a forum on faith-related issues at Messiah College in Grantham, Penn.
ruling_headline: Yes, from American Evita to The Very Unofficial Hillary Clinton Coloring Book
statement: Says she is the subject of 60 books.

ruling_headline: Obama served on board with Ayers
statement: Obama served on a board with former Weather Underground member William Ayers and "that relationship with Mr. Ayers on this board continued after 9/11."

statement_context: an interview with the Philadelphia Daily News editorial board
ruling_headline: He had it wrapped up in March
statement: "My husband didn't wrap up the nomination until June."

statement_context: a news conference in Greensburg, Pa.
ruling_headline: 'Very well' in Mass. and Calif.
statement: "I did very well with young people in Ohio, Massachusetts, California."

ruling_headline: Nope, Obama was first in the Senate, too
statement: "I actually started criticizing the war in Iraq before (Obama) did."

ruling_headline: She was no emissary to the obscure
statement: As first lady, Clinton would travel to places that were "too small, too poor or too dangerous" for the president.

ruling_headline: That's not the whole plan
statement: McCain's "plan for the economy is to extend George Bush's tax cuts for billionaires and give a $100-billion additional corporate tax cut."

ruling_headline: Video shows tarmac welcome, no snipers
statement: "I remember landing under sniper fire."

statement_context: a campaign rally in Harrisburg, Pa.
ruling_headline: A boost, not an impediment, to clean energy
statement: Obama voted for "tax subsidies and giveways" that have slowed oil companies from pursuing clean energy sources.

statement_context: an interview on CNN's American Morning
ruling_headline: A great speech, but what else?
statement: "I've been standing up against ... the Chinese government over women's rights and standing up for human rights."

ruling_headline: A small but significant role
statement: "I helped to bring peace to Northern Ireland."

ruling_headline: Clinton visited Kosovo refugees, but ...
statement: "I negotiated open borders to let fleeing refugees into safety from Kosovo."

statement_context: a campaign event in Hanging Rock, Ohio.
ruling_headline: His plan includes adults
statement: Obama "only wants your children to have health insurance."

ruling_headline: She's often first, but is that a bad thing?
statement: "Could I just point out that ... I seem to get the first question all the time?"

ruling_headline: Et tu, Clinton?
statement: Obama "basically threatened to bomb Pakistan."

ruling_headline: Obama's Iraq remark taken out of context
statement: Barack Obama said in 2004 "that he basically agreed with the way George Bush was conducting the war."

ruling_headline: Dormant while Obama campaigns
statement: "He (Obama) chairs the subcommittee on Europe. ... He's held not one substantive hearing to do oversight."

ruling_headline: Clinton at times forgets major caveats
statement: "I want to freeze interest rates for five years."

statement_context: a campaign event in Robstown, Texas.
ruling_headline: She has experience, but maybe not at math
statement: Says the difference between her and Barack Obama is "about 35 years of experience."

statement_context: a TV ad airing in Iowa and New Hampshire.
ruling_headline: Many years of politics and advocacy
statement: "I have 35 years' experience making change."

ruling_headline: Both caucus losers, but she's more thorough
statement: "I have something in common with my husband. He never carried caucuses either. He lost all of the ones that I've lost."

ruling_headline: Yes, but it's complicated.
statement: "On issue after issue that really were hard to explain or understand, you voted present . . . And anytime anyone raises that, there's always some kind of explanation."

ruling_headline: Clinton stands alone on health care mandate
statement: Hillary Clinton "has the only health care plan that covers every American."

statement_context: a conference call to reporters led by Cilnton pollster Mark Penn
ruling_headline: Obama's real competition has been Democrats
statement: "Senator Obama has, in fact, never had a serious Republican challenger."

ruling_headline: He voted "present," which is similar to "no"
statement: In the Illinois Legislature, Barack Obama "voted 'present,' instead of yes or no" on seven votes involving abortion rights.

ruling_headline: 50,000 started war without body armor
statement: "George Bush sent people to war without body armor."

statement_context: a debate in Myrtle Beach, S.C.
ruling_headline: A fragment of truth, distorted
statement: "I was fighting against those (Republican) ideas when you were practicing law and representing your contributor, Rezko, in his slum landlord business in inner city Chicago."

ruling_headline: Her words are somewhat misleading
statement: The Bush administration has "the Pentagon trying to take away the signing bonuses when a soldier gets wounded and ends up in the hospital, something that I'm working with a Republican senator to try to make sure never can happen again."

ruling_headline: Exelon staff supports Obama
statement: "Barack (Obama) has one of his biggest supporters in terms of funding, the Exelon Corporation, which has spent millions of dollars trying to make Yucca Mountain the waste depository."

ruling_headline: No, it was a boon to renewable fuel industry
statement: "So that 2005 energy bill was a big step backwards on the path to clean, renewable energy. That's why I voted against it."

ruling_headline: That's no typo, 100 years
statement: "You know, Sen. McCain said the other day that we might have troops (in Iraq) for 100 years..."

ruling_headline: Lobbyists live in Obama's glass house
statement: "Sen. Obama's chair in New Hampshire is a lobbyist. He lobbies for the drug companies."

ruling_headline: Clinton promoted children's health care
statement: "There are 7,000 kids in New Hampshire who have health care because I helped to create the Children's Health Insurance Program."

ruling_headline: He fought to improve it, then voted for it
statement: "You said you would vote against the Patriot Act, then you came to the Senate, you voted for it."

ruling_headline: Her comparison is too selective
statement: "Average families are spending roughly $2,000 more a year on energy costs. ... It's like a $2,000 energy tax in just the last seven years, more than three times what the typical American family received from the Bush tax cuts."

statement_context: a comment to a shopper at a supermarket in Des Moines, Iowa.
ruling_headline: If she's right, Bill's a criminal
statement: "I can't sign money. That's illegal."

statement_context: a town hall meeting in Derry, N.H.
ruling_headline: Need, not wealth, prompted estate taxes
statement: "The estate tax, which came into being by Republicans like Teddy Roosevelt and others ... is there for a real simple reason: In America, we've never liked the idea of massive inherited wealth."

ruling_headline: Indeed, Bush did it his way
statement: "George Bush ... used a signing statement (on a FEMA bill) to say, 'I don't have to follow that, unless I choose to.' "

ruling_headline: The ugly truths
statement: "Productivity has risen 18 percent ...yet wages have stayed flat... There are 5-million more people in poverty here in our country than there were in 2000."

ruling_headline: Can't blame Bush
statement: "Thanks to President Bush's policies....The income gap is now higher than at any time since the Great Depression."

ruling_headline: A legitimate beef with ham sandwich regulations
statement: "A ham and cheese sandwich on one slice of bread is the responsibility of the USDA ... But a ham and cheese sandwich on two slices of bread is the responsibility of the Food and Drug Administration."

ruling_headline: Ridiculous evidence -- but true
statement: "Senator Obama's relatives and friends say he has been talking about running for president for at least the last 15 years," a campaign spokesman said.

ruling_headline: 15-million is okay guess, but not a fact
statement: Barack Obama's health care plan "would leave 15-million Americans out."

ruling_headline: Obama's plan would leave out some, but nobody knows how many
statement: Barack Obama's health care plan "would leave 15 million Americans out."

ruling_headline: A lot of time, but the math is off
statement: "Americans spend 100-million hours a year filling out these forms (FAFSA). That is the equivalent of 55,500 full-time jobs."

ruling_headline: Edwards was worried about cost
statement: "When Sen. Edwards ran in 2004, he wasn't for universal health care. I'm glad he is now."

ruling_headline: Not all records are available
statement: "All of the records, as far as I know, about what we did with health care, those are already available."

ruling_headline: Why withhold when you can delay?
statement: "My husband has not withheld a single document."

ruling_headline: NIH funding is up under Bush
statement: "It's just outrageous that under President Bush, the National Institutes of Health have been basically decreased in funding."

ruling_headline: Tax for the rich only, but not anymore
statement: "The Alternative Minimum Tax was never intended to hit people in middle income, upper middle income. It was meant for people who are rich and evading taxes."

ruling_headline: Cherry-picking Obama's quotes
statement: Sen. Obama "made the very argument he is now criticizing back in November 2006."

ruling_headline: He's stretching the story
statement: Nearly half of Hispanic voters in Arizona's last election supported four measures that were "very tough on illegal immigration."

statement_context: a TV ad airing in Iowa and New Hampshire.
ruling_headline: There were 22 other co-sponsors
statement: "She stood by our National Guard and Reserve and kept standing till they received health care they deserved."

ruling_headline: She's been active on issues for 9/11 workers
statement: "She stood by ground zero workers who sacrificed their health after so many sacrificed their lives and kept standing till this administration took action."

statement_context: a TV ad airing in Iowa and New Hampshire.
ruling_headline: Standing up, but not alone
statement: "Hillary stood up for universal health care when almost no one else would, and kept standing till 6-million kids had coverage."

statement_context: a forum hosted by Slate/Yahoo/Huffington Post.
ruling_headline: No records, but there are witnesses
statement: "Look, I believe in accountability. In 1983, I led the effort in Arkansas to improve our schools."

statement_context: a speech in Des Moines, Iowa.
ruling_headline: Optimistic math
statement: Her health care plan will cost $110-billion in the first year, which can be paid for with savings.

statement_context: a speech in Des Moines, Iowa.
ruling_headline: Indeed, uninsured people have higher mortality rate
statement: "Each year, 18,000 people die in America because they don't have health care."

statement_context: a speech in Des Moines, Iowa.
ruling_headline: A broad definition of "medical bills"
statement: Half of all personal bankruptcies in America "are caused by medical bills."

statement_context: a speech in Des Moines, Iowa.
ruling_headline: Studies confirm premiums are up 98 percent
statement: Health insurance premiums "have almost doubled ... since 2000."

ruling_headline: Little impact from making English 'official'
statement: English "is our national language...if it becomes official, that means in a place like New York City you can't print ballots in any other language."

ruling_headline: Indeed, Hispanics have highest percentage
statement: \u201CThirty-four percent of Hispanics don\u2019t have any health care at all, don\u2019t have any health insurance.\u201D

statement_context: a speech by husband Bill Clinton at a Concord, N.H. rally.
ruling_headline: Hillary is famous in Europe
statement: "In every single country, she had a majority of the vote -- or more of those who'd already made up their minds."

ruling_headline: Black and Hispanic homeowners have more subprimes
statement: "About 40 percent of Hispanic homeowners have subprime mortgages."

statement_context: a comment by husband Bill Clinton on Larry King Live.
ruling_headline: But N.Y. numbers may not be meaningful elsewhere
statement: "In New York, when she ran for reelection, she carried 58 of our 62 counties. George Bush had won 40 counties in New York just two years earlier."

ruling_headline: There are plenty of jobs available for trained automobile and airline technicians, but Clinton overestimates how much they pay.
statement: "Let's pay attention to kids who are not going to college, which ends up being about 60 percent of the kids... and get them trained for the jobs that are there. Because, you know, there are auto mechanic jobs paying $50,000, $60,000 that they can't get filled. There are airline mechanic jobs paying a lot of money that can't get filled." Remarks at AFSCME forum 6/19/2007

ruling_headline: An accurate summary of economic stats
statement: "Corporate profits are up, CEO pay is up, but average wages of Americans are flat."
